member.name: IDirect3DIndexBuffer9.GetDesc
member.summary: Retrieves a description of the index buffer resource.
member.param: Pointer to a D3DINDEXBUFFER_DESC structure, describing the returned index buffer.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. D3DERR_INVALIDCALL is returned if the argument is invalid.

member.name: IDirect3DIndexBuffer9.Lock
member.summary: Locks a range of index data and obtains a pointer to the index buffer memory.
member.param: Offset into the index data to lock, in bytes. Lock the entire index buffer by specifying 0 for both parameters, SizeToLock and OffsetToLock.
Size of the index data to lock, in bytes. Lock the entire index buffer by specifying 0 for both parameters, SizeToLock and OffsetToLock.
VOID* pointer to a memory buffer containing the returned index data.

Combination of zero or more locking flags that describe the type of lock to perform. For this method, the valid flags are:
D3DLOCK_DISCARD
D3DLOCK_NO_DIRTY_UPDATE
D3DLOCK_NOSYSLOCK
D3DLOCK_READONLY
D3DLOCK_NOOVERWRITE
For a description of the flags, see D3DLOCK.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be D3DERR_INVALIDCALL.

member.name: IDirect3DIndexBuffer9.Unlock
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be D3DERR_INVALIDCALL.

member.name: IDirect3DIndexBuffer9
member.summary: Applications use the methods of the IDirect3DIndexBuffer9 interface to manipulate an index buffer resource.
